story.kicker_image_caption: File photo of Mithali Raj. (PTI Photo)
story.storykicker: Playing in cricket leagues outside the country is bound to improve the quality of women's cricket in the country.
story.storybody:
In a significant move, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is all set to allow women players to play in tournaments like the Women's Big Bash League (WBBL).

The move is seen as a step further in developing the women's game after the cricket board planned to introduce central contracts for them.

"India's women cricketers can now play in overseas leagues in Australia and England, subject to their contracts being approved by the BCCI. The decision, taken during a meeting of the BCCI's women's cricket committee on Wednesday, paves the way for India's players to take part in tournaments such as the Women's Big Bash League in Australia and the Women's Super League in England," espncricinfo.com reported on Thursday.

However, BCCI's announcement may have come too late, as the inaugural WSL will be held from July 30 to August 14 and the Indian board is yet to decide on the issue when the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) sent a letter to all full members seeking their permission to enlist players.

The ECB signed up 18 overseas players - from Australia, New Zealand, South Africa and the West Indies - and unveiled its final squad lists in April.

Similarly, in the inaugural WBBL, there was no Indian representation in any of the franchises.
story.magazinekicker: Playing in cricket leagues outside the country is bound to improve the quality of women's cricket in the country.
story.shortheadline: BCCI gives thumbs up to women players for overseas leagues
story.storytitle: BCCI gives thumbs up to women players for overseas leagues
story.longheadline: BCCI gives thumbs up to women players for overseas leagues
story.strapheadline: Women's players will get much-needed exposure playing in leagues overseas.

story.twitternarrative: BCCI gives thumbs up to women players for overseas leagues

briefcase_content.briefcase: BCCI to allow women players to play in tournaments like Big Bash League
Women's Super League is set to take place in England from July 30
WSL will feature players from Australia
